header.title: About Me
header.subtitle: Summa Cum Laude Computer Science graduate from Northeastern University with a passion for building innovative solutions and leading technical teams

bio: My journey into programming began in eighth grade when I joined my middle school's robotics team. What started as curiosity evolved into a 9+ year passion that has taken me from building Arduino projects to leading engineering teams at cutting-edge tech companies.

At Northeastern University, I graduated Summa Cum Laude with a B.S. in Computer Science and a concentration in Artificial Intelligence. My coursework spanned from fundamental algorithms to advanced machine learning, preparing me for the complex challenges I've tackled in my professional roles.

Through co-ops at VMware and the Broad Institute of MIT and Harvard, plus my role as Tech Lead at Generate Product Development, I've gained hands-on experience in enterprise software development, distributed systems, and team leadership. I've also founded my own software consultancy, delivering mobile solutions for non-profit organizations.

journey.title: The Beginning
journey.description: Started programming in 8th grade on my middle school's robotics team

journey.title: High School
journey.description: FIRST Robotics Competition team member, Code Club projects from LED snowflakes to mobile apps

journey.title: Northeastern University
journey.description: B.S. Computer Science with AI concentration, Summa Cum Laude (3.93 GPA)

journey.title: Professional Experience
journey.description: Tech Lead at Generate, Software Engineer Co-op at Broad Institute & VMware
